snippet: A report that showed rising American unemployment in May added to the global pall that has deepened with Europe’s escalating debt crisis and slowing growth in China and India.
abstract: Labor Department reports that the unemployment rate increased to 8.2 percent in May from 8.1 percent in April, as the nation's employers added 69,000 jobs, the fewest in a year; report marks the third consecutive month of disappointing results, leaving little doubt that the economic recovery is floundering; higher unemployment rate is a significant liability for Pres Obama's re-election effort.
lead_paragraph: A report that showed rising American unemployment in May added to the global pall that has deepened with Europe’s escalating debt crisis and slowing growth in China and India.

headline.seo: Weak Job Growth in May as Unemployment Rate Ticked Up
headline.main: Feeble U.S. Job Growth Stokes Fears of Global Slowdown
headline.print_headline: Job Growth Weak For Third Month, As Recovery Lags
